decks.notes: The deck is centered around casting a variety of spells and utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw cards and gain card advantage. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, cantrips, and versatile multicolored cards to control the game and answer threats from the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Bring to Light and Glittering Wish to tutor for specific answers in the sideboard. The mana base is designed to support casting a wide range of multicolored spells efficiently. The main goal is to outvalue the opponent and win through card advantage and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponent's resources and locking down their mana base with cards like Pillage and Magus of the Moon. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf while generating card advantage with Wrenn and Six and Seasoned Pyromancer. Klothys, God of Destiny provides continuous value and disruption while powerful creatures like Bloodbraid Elf and Stoneforge Mystic put pressure on the opponent. The equipment package of Sword of Feast and Famine, Batterskull, and Embercleave can close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through countermagic and removal spells, while generating card advantage with versatile cards like Archmage's Charm and Cryptic Command. The deck also aims to stabilize the board with efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The key strategy is to use Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull to close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed with snow lands and utility lands to ensure consistency in casting spells and activating abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to combine elements of control and aggression to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with creatures like Glorybringer and Questing Beast. Utilizing cards like Pillage and Magus of the Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck aims to slow down their strategy and gain an advantage. The inclusion of Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Seasoned Pyromancer provides card advantage and additional threats, while Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf help ramp up the mana to cast big threats like Klothys, God of Destiny.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Noble Hierarch and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team, combined with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage to control the board, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play, while Cavern of Souls ensures the creatures can't be countered. This aggressive aggro strategy aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of artifact synergies and disruptive spells. By using cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Thopter Foundry/Sword of the Meek combo, the deck can generate value and create a board presence while also slowing down the opponent with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Damping Sphere. The deck utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Goblin Engineer to dig for key pieces while also having access to removal and disruption like Engineered Explosives and Pithing Needle. The aim is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through resource management and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources while ramping into powerful threats. The deck focuses on using cards like Pillage and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while also making use of the Utopia Sprawl enchantment for additional ramp. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Glorybringer and Questing Beast to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Overall, the goal is to efficiently control the game while establishing a strong board presence to secure a win.

This Modern Urza Control deck focuses on utilizing artifact synergy and card advantage to control the game. By using cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck can generate mana and card advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Metallic Rebuke. The deck also includes removal like Galvanic Blast and Engineered Explosives to deal with threats on the board. With a mana base that supports its diverse color requirements, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through card advantage and control.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to quickly cast powerful threats like Glorybringer and Bloodbraid Elf. Magus of the Moon helps disrupt opponent's mana base while Klothys, God of Destiny provides continuous value and graveyard hate. Chandra, Torch of Defiance offers additional removal and card advantage, making it difficult for the opponent to mount a comeback.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying low-cost, efficient creatures to pressure the opponent and close out games as fast as possible. It uses cards like Goblin Guide, Burning-Tree Emissary, and Wild Nacatl to apply early pressure, with additional support from cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Atarka's Command to enhance creatures and push damage through. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of creatures, burn spells, and combat tricks to ensure a quick victory.

This Gruul Utopia Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, while disrupting opponents with Pillage and Magus of the Moon. It utilizes powerful threats like Chandra and Glorybringer to pressure opponents and control the board. Klothys, God of Destiny provides both life gain and graveyard hate. Scavenging Ooze helps with graveyard hate and incremental life gain. Bloodbraid Elf and Seasoned Pyromancer provide card advantage and board presence. Overall, this deck aims to control the game tempo while deploying powerful threats to win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources through a combination of removal spells, card advantage, and counterspells. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, alongside efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to provide additional win conditions. By managing the opponent's threats and resources while generating card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent in a drawn-out game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes snow-covered lands and synergies with cards such as Arcum's Astrolabe and Dead of Winter to gain incremental advantage while shutting down opponents' threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like The Royal Scions and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional card selection and win conditions. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while slowly grinding out value and eventually overwhelming them with powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It uses a combination of counterspells like Mana Leak and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict to keep the opponent's board in check. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage and control. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides value and card advantage while also gaining life. Additionally, the deck uses Snow lands and Ice-Fang Coatl for mana fixing and card draw.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish board control and outvalue the opponent through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, and versatile counterspells like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command. Additionally, the deck aims to generate card advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl, while also having a solid manabase to ensure consistency and flexibility in its plays.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful cards from the graveyard, such as Mishra's Bauble and Engineered Explosives, in order to combo off and win the game quickly. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Teferi, Time Raveler provide card selection and recursion, while cards like Arcum's Astrolabe and Mox Amber help to generate mana and fix colors. The inclusion of cards like Thassa's Oracle and Monastery Mentor offer alternative win conditions in case the primary combo is disrupted. This deck aims to take advantage of powerful synergies and combos to overwhelm opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.
